Over 8 years I have been to Sydney 6 times and to the gardens more than 12 times. If I lived in the city I would go very often. It's a true oasis in the heart of the city and what ever the weather it's worth a visit. Whether you have an hour to spare, or half a day, it's the perfect place to relax and explore. At just $6 an adult entry it's a perfect place to visit. The tea room is lovely offering a range of teas, sandwiches, dim sum and cakes. It had a lovely view over the garden and you can site an unwind, and rest your feet whilst watching the koi and birds. A must place to visit when in Sydney and my favourite place on the planet.
A little bit of peae in a big city. This was a fabulous interlude to our busy day. Even though it was cloudy with intermittent rain it was a pleasure to wander the gardens and soak up the peace.

Very picturesque!. I just happened to walk past this gem on my walk from Darling Harbour to Chinatown. It looks so serene, even while it was raining. I didn't get to go inside but the outside is gorgeous on its own. There is nearby construction though.
Wonderful little garden. A peaceful oasis in a busy city. Beautiful for photography, lots of info about the plants and a great place to sit down for a relaxing cup of tea

Absolutely beautiful . Very cheap entry fee ($3 for me, a Pensioner, I think $6 for adults?) and beautifully kept gardens. Also much bigger than I thought! It's more like a museum as there are traditional buildings and pottery displays. Huge water features and a lovely tea house on the premises serving a variety of Chinese tea and snacks as well as some western stuff. I spent hours here! There is a place where you can be dressed in imperial Chinese attire as well!This place seems to be about exchange and learning about Chinese culture. There are plaques everywhere explaining the gardens design and significance as a place symbolising the Chinese/Australian friendship. The women who dressed me were Chinese and they told me all about the clothes.

Oasis in the City. This is a really lovely garden and has plenty of information about the plants and shrubs and buildings and what they mean in Chinese culture. It was very interesting and not expensive to get in.
Beautiful.. Beautiful and tranquil. Worth the trip. Just buy a ticket when you get there, you get a map and get to explore it yourself.

Mystical. This is a very mystical and beautiful place to visit. Our three children had so much fun as you can dress up in Chinese clothing(one son as an emperor the other a warrior and my daughter a chinese Princess) and wander around the gardens taking photos in the costumes. The gardens are so beautiful and special. Our camera died sothe lovely people who run the costume shop generously lent us thier camera for our visit and then emailed the photos to us. Lovely day.
Such a surprise. Walking past didn't think much but once inside WOW so beautiful, peaceful,Very unexpected in the middle of the city just awesome.It is a must do when in Sydney.
Very beautiful, calming and peaceful and interesting too.. Easy to drop by from Darling Harbour and gives a nice respite from the busy sightseeing days. Go for half an hour or stay for 2 or 3 hours!

A haven amid city construction. Such a beautiful garden - set amid the cross traffic patterns of the city it offers real respite. Right on the edge of CHinatown so after filling your senses with the calm and quiet and the beautiful plantings and landscape of this jewel of a park, you can fill your stomach too! It's on all the tourist maps.
Ying and yang. Get your Chi in harmony with your quest for balance in your life with a visit to this oasis of calm in the heart of the city.

Lovely. Having visited China last year, we found these gardens to be a great reminder of all the things that we had seen and enjoyed in that country. Despite it raining throughout our visit, we really enjoyed wandering along all the paths within the garden. It was just like China in miniature.
Relax in the beautiful Chinese Garden. This is amazing garden in the middle of the city. The garden is beautiful and really big. Amazing place in Sydney.

A little piece of Chinese style paradise in the heart of Sydney. Not too big, but just enough to have a wonder round. Very peaceful gardens with helpful staff. Strongly recommend it if you're visiting Darling Harbour. (P.s. make sure to try the café, very good teas)
Oasis of tranquility. Beautiful gardens, pleasantly cool on a really hot day when we visited. A real antidote to city life. Nice little cafe to have a drink or snack. Beautiful place to visit.

Heavenly!. This garden is so well planned that every view inside its walls is postcard perfect. Every sight line, every angle, was carefully considered. It's peaceful, beautiful, and soothing, and -- more amazingly -- right in the middle of the city (Darling Harbour).

Peaceful gardens. A really lovely, relaxing spot in the centre of the city. I was surprised how much seems to fit in a small area here, it's been well constructed, with many levels to provide different environments and varied viewpoints. It's an odd contrast seeing the tranquil lake, trees and pagodas with towering skyscrapers beyond the garden walls. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful Asian spot in a western style city. Beautiful garden, very relaxing and clean. A not expensive tour to do. A must see place in Sydney. Follow the map and relax inside this small paradise.
Beautiful Chinese gardens in Sydney.. Beautiful Chinese gardens in Darling Harbour Sydney, transports you to a different place. Very calming. Nicely developed gardens.

A sanctuary in the heart of the city. A must for garden lovers who enjoy an Asian garden. Beautifully landscaped. We enjoyed this sanctuary. Stop for a tea or coffee and enjoy the views of water, waterfalls, landscaping and birds.

A beautiful, peaceful, taste of the Orient in the heart of the city. The Chinese Garden of friendship is a fantastic little place, right in the middle of the city. Its absolutely beautiful, with fabulous chinese architecture and its so peaceful. There are Lizards, Ibis, Turtles, and other wildlife can be found here. Just take your own time and relax among the beauty.

Guided Tour of the Chinese Garden of Friendship. Admission was only AU$6. Ensure to pick up a map of the garden at the entrance. I had arrived at the garden just in time to attend a free guided tour of the highlights of the garden. It was quite informative and I highly recommend it. The tour only lasted about 30 minutes and afterwards, I continued to enjoy the garden.The garden is a peaceful and relaxing area to escape from the bustling city. For tea and other food and beverages in the garden, there is The Teahouse.

Beautiful place. Such a nice and calming place to visit!!! It was breathtaking!!! We loved it!!! The thing I liked the most was that we were able to dress into Chinese geisha costumes and take photos and at a very low price!!

Great location in the heart of Sydney. When you visit Darling Harbour the Chinese Garden is one place not to be missed.
Peace and tranquility so close to Sydney CBD.
Tranquility amid the hustle and bustle. . We spent a delightful hour walking through these beautiful gardens. At $6.00 it will be one of the least expensive attractions you will see. Well worth it.

Beautiful relaxing place. Loved it, so peaceful and stunning gardens. Price is excellent at $6per adult well worth it.
Staff friendly and knowledgable about the gardens
Relaxing. taking a leisurely stroll through these gardens is very relaxing , feed the fish , lizards and turtles ..great for all ages

A great little surprise not far from city centre. Not far from Darling harbour are the gardens. We killed an hour here. You are surrounded by buildings and industry but it doesn't feel like it. Great place to get away from it all. The highlight was renting traditional clothing and taking photos.

Well worth the time... We regularly visit here when in Sydney. Peaceful, with amazing sights at every turn.. A reasonably priced Tea Room, overlooking the water full of what seems to be thousands of Koi fish! I managed to navigate the whole place with my walking stick and an occasional steadying hand from my hubby. They offer very reasonable priced entry and we were glad we opted for the package of afternoon tea and entry. The Bonsai were a real treat!

Peace and Tranquility amidst a busy City !. A beautifully planned and executed Chinese Garden this is well worth a visit. Once you enter it's difficult to believe you are still in the middle of a very busy city. Wonder round and enjoy the abundance of plants, rocks, water features and fish but do it slowly and soak up the atmosphere. If you follow the "tour" route you will come to a door and upon entering will be given the opportunity to put on some traditional Chinese clothes (men and women) and take photographs ($10 charge).

Nice gardens. Although small, these gardens are quite peaceful while being in the middle of the city. There's a cafe where you can order light food and drinks (such as tea) that you can enjoy at tables near the water. It is really quite scenic.

Love this place. These amazing gardens are well worth a visit. If you are into garden design this a must to visit whilst in Sydney. After a day of wandering around this wonderful place, take the short walk to Chinatown and enjoy a wonderful Chinese meal.

Excellent example of chinese gardening. We weren't sure about this, but, in the event it was really peaceful and atmospheric. not very large, but the best things come in small packages. You or your kids can hire Chinese costumes to wear which makes great photo opportunities
Beautiful. The gardens are beautiful and it's a great place to wander through, look at the fish and have a cup of tea. Very peaceful.

Peace & tranquility . A great way to spend a quiet hour away from the city
Lovely gardens & waterfalls you forget your in the middle of a busy city and for $6 entry fee it's money well spent !
Don't get sucked into buying this as a tourist trip as I've seen it advertised for $48 !

A little disappointing.. I visited this garden about 8 years ago and was thrilled with it. On my recent visit it seemed to lack atmosphere and was not as well kept as previously. Nevertheless, worth dropping in and paying the entrance fee.

Amazing. If you love scenery and a nice quiet beautiful scene then this is a great place. It was a nice walk through. Very quiet and pretty. I ran into a local drawing in there she said she goes in all the time to draw as she is an artist as its beautiful and gives her inspiration. I would definetly go back.

Oasis of peace in the middle of the city. Outside the chinese garden of friendship, sydney was hectic, but inside tranquility descended. It's definitely worth a visit for a stroll. There's a wide variety of plants, settings, carvings and ducks in the area.

A quick escape from the city rush. A nice and quiet place for a quick escape from the city rush. The price is very convenient (just a couple of dollars), the gardens are really well designed, clean and welcoming. It's a very nice way to spend 1 hour away from the noisy Sydney daylife and a perfect location to take good pictures or just read a book.

Oasis in the chaos. Went to the gardens for my birthday and had an enjoyable time. There is a wave of calm that washes over you in the gardens which is why I like visiting. They are well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Nice and peaceful in a busy city. A nice bit of peace and quiet in the heart of a busy city. Definitely worth a visit. It's somewhere I passed by often but only visited when a friend was in town. Don't miss it!
A Peaceful Experience. Beautiful and tranquil experience, very relaxing in the inner city, take your time and enjoy all the different views from each aspect of the gardens

Tranquil Garden. Beautiful garden!!! Has a cafe here that serves dumplings, quiche and gluten free tarts which was quite nice. They have water dragons here....sometimes you have to have a good eye to spot them though. Nice and relaxing place to visit.

Very impressive garden area. I visited the garden here the morning before my flight back home. The staff at the ticket counter were very friendly and I was pleased to hear your ticket allows all day entry and can therefore come and go as you please into the gardens. This was useful for me as I had to go back to my hotel to check out of my room and then return to the garden to finish exploring the garden.I am not really into gardens but I have to say that I was very impressed by this one. It was great seeing various birds going in, out and through the garden as well as turtles and some other reptile looking lizards/goannas having the garden as their home.The various buildings in the garden were amazing to look at and the place seemed so peaceful.Having explored the garden, I am now even more inspired to go on a holiday to Asia some day so I can see more impressive beauty like of the beauty in Sydney's Chinese Garden of Friendship.

Wonderful Oasis. The garden is a beautiful, tranquil area in the busy inner city. The path through it leads you from one glorious vista to the next. We have enjoyed two visits to this attraction over the years and it should not be missed from your plans.
Chinese Oasis. The Chinese garden is an oasis of tranquility in the heart of the city. This authentic garden transports you to China taking you on a journey of discovery.

Beautiful Garden. Beautiful gardens, very peaceful and relaxing. Some of the plants were in bloom, stunning. There is a cost of $6 to go inside but i think it's worth it. I suppose you are paying for the upkeep of the gardens!

Beautiful!. These gardens are so beautiful and tranquil. The walk is soothing and peaceful.We took advantage of wearing the traditional Chinese costumes during our afternoon there and we all felt like royalty. A relaxing place to visit.
Pay to enter. These gardens looked beautiful from the outside, and it was a shame they wanted $15 to look around inside. I personally could not see the value for money.

Nice, but shouldn't be your priority in Sydney.. The place is beautiful and peaceful. It is an interesting mix peace vs the city centre, but if you don't have much time to visit Sydney, I wouldn't suggest you to go there.
Beautiful Garden in the Heart of Sydney. Beautiful gardens, a lovely relaxing walk. A breath of fresh air for this area in Sydney.Visited in late spring, a few magnolias in bloom.

Peace and Quiet in a big City.. Beautiful gardens in a large development at Darling Harbour.When inside you will forget you are in a big city. The gardens are beautiful and peaceful.Chinese costumes are available to hire and on warm days a cool pack is placed underneath the garments to keep you cool. A good camera is a must and you will be rewarded with beautiful pictures. Your friends will be impressed.
Tranquil place in the heart of the city.. Lovely, peaceful and tranquil place, right in the heart of Sydney. Nice place to just chill before or after facing the hustle and bustle of the city.

Tranquil beauty. My teenage daughter would much prefer to be inside on her technology. However, half way around the Chinese Gardens she said how beautiful and peaceful it was to be there - even with the three large school groups and construction works outside!If you love photography then this is the place to get some beautiful photos of the lovely gardens and waterfalls.Lots of Chinese history throughout as well.

Pleasantly Surprised. Have to admit I wasn't keen to pay the entry fee but the rest of the family insisted. What a beautiful, tranquil garden in the middle of a very busy city. Great photo opportunities. Very cool to get so close to the big lizard things too. Much more impressive once you get through the gate than it looks from the outside.
Tranquility in a big City. Beautiful, tranquil place to relax.My daughter loves anything oriental. follow the paths to find all of the Chinese Zodiacs.

Peace and quite in a busy city. What a lovely little bit of peace and quiet in bustling Darling Harbour! Once inside, you immediately forget what is going on outside.The gardens are beautiful and a credit to the gardeners who work there. The little tea shop also does a really nice morning tea.
Could be in China.. Beautiful garden to wander around. Surprisingly peaceful in the middle of town. Find a quiet nook and enjoy some solitude.

Nice Chinese garden, worth a visit.. A nice garden, probably worth a look if its not busy and you are in the area. A peaceful area in amongst the hustle and bustle of the city, you would never realize you are in the city!

A beautiful and tranquil place. We visited this beautiful garden which is situated in Darling Harbour in the midst of bustling traffic and activity. I can't find enough words to describe the peace and tranquility we experienced amongst the magnificent plants and ponds. It is definitely a must see for anyone lucky enough to visit the wonderful city of Sydney. There is also a day where seniors can enter free!

Nice garden for a teabreak!. Nice garden in the middle of the city. Unfortunately, there is lots of noise due to the construction work in Darling Harbour. Its not too expensive and the garden itself is very pretty. Go to the little cafe for a teabreak and enjoy this Chinese Garden of Friendship.

A surprising gem close to Darling Harbour. Great family experience close to Darling Harbour. Lovely game of 'find the clue' provided by the Gardens which had the kids busy and entertained. Great opportunity to put Chinese costumes on and walk the gardens in costume. Very relaxed and fun experience.

Tranquility in the middle of a busy city. Cheap entry price for a whole days admission, located just behind Darling Harbour and bordering China town, a beautiful marvel in a busy city. I went there one afternoon and walked around taking in the monuments and watching the Coy in the ponds. There is also a little cafe where you can sit in the sun under the veranda with a pot of Jasmine tea watching time pass you by. You can also have the opportunity to dress in traditional clothes and have your photo taken against the waterfall. Would go again.

Peaceful and Relaxing. Only $6 to enter, It is very peaceful and relaxing. I would highly recommend it for both adults and kids. You can dress up as you walk around the garden and there is a lot to see in the garden. There is a cafe just before the exit to the garden where you can have some chinese tea and cakes amongst other foods.
Absolutely wonderful. Having been here when first opened I was amazed at what I saw. It is just magnificent. Absolutely wonderful

Friday get away . Had a wonderful time so relaxing! Great little spot in the heart of the city.Quite cheap entry. Was fun to watch everyone get dressed up. Had a nice cuppa and some dumplings not the best but still nice in the environment

Excellent. This is an amazing place - so peaceful - I would go again and again if I lived close enough. So many different vistas every time you turned a corner. Great too as we went in school hols and they had activities for children included in the entry cost. The lantern making was very popular - my grandson loved it and came home with an awesome paper lantern [complete with battery operated light - all included] which looks amazing. There was also story telling but sadly we did not have enough time for that. Highly recommended.

Tranquility. Sydney is a bustling city full of tourists, workers and (at the moment) construction....every now and then you might feel the need to get away and this is a perfect spot to grab some well needed peace and quiet. The gardens are beautifully laid out in the traditional style and there are birds and lizards running free in the park. The leaflets are informative and give a great deal of information about Chinese culture and traditions.....lovely.
Short stay Sydney. Beautiful and peaceful garden to have a walk around in. Location just outside darling harbour. Perfect to get some rest from the busy streets
Beautiful tranquil gardens. Absolutely beautiful, very peaceful and full of lovely plantings and sculptures. Easy to forget you are in the middle of the city.
A peice of peace in chaos. Love visiting this beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. Gorgeous Chinese gardens to walk around, then have some tea at the end. Worth a visit
love this place. it is so piece full here i could stay all day and they gave us a special entry pricetruly recommend coming its near darling harbour so take advantage of seeing this as well

Beautiful and peaceful, but small.. Surprisingly this garden in the middle of Sydney is really a Chinese Garden. It's peaceful and beautiful. It's actually a good spot if you want to do photos with Chinese traditional costumes. They actually have the store where you can rent the costumes and stroll around the garden taking photos in them. My sister took our photos in black and white and they looked great!It's a small garden though, I think we only spend around an hour there. However the entry fee is low, so it's really worth it.

Tranquility abounds in the heart of the city. Love, Love, Love the Chinese Garden of Friendship! We visit every time we are in Sydney. So far we've seen the garden in Summer and in early Spring. Just gorgeous. Tranquility abounds in the heart of the city. Thank you!
tranquil. very peacefull,a beautifull place to spend some time in a busy city.we enjoyed our walk through the gardens learning some of the history.
Moment of peace. This was a nice little oasis in the middle of the city, nice and relaxing, beautiful flowers and surroundings. Where price worthy the low entrance fee.

a place full of surprises. Let me tell you a secret Lets walk form Pier street into an other world full and beautiful A secret garden? A place to escape; to breathe deeply and feel the sun on your face. Darling Harbour’s Chinese Garden is that place. After a great meal in Darling harbour or China town around the corner s where these garden can be found behind the high wallsIt is more than just a city garden, the walled Chinese Garden respectfully recreates the philosophy and harmony of a traditional Chinese garden with waterfalls, lakes, exotic plants, pavilions and hidden pathways. In the water pounds full with koi carp swimming, willows weeping in the breeze. a Teahouse serving Chinese tea and dim sum is also available, be careful when you discover Darling Harbour’s secret garden—you may never want to leave.For a small $6.00 fee will let you enter or take a tour

Magical!. This was a totally unexpected find in the hustle and bustle of Darling Harbour. The garden is walled and beautifully maintained. It is a peaceful and serene oasis and wasn't busy at all when we were there on a Wednesday at the end of August. It is quite cheap at $6 per person.There are waterfalls and pavilions and some really large koi carp in the lakes. The Teahouse serves Chinese tea, dim sums and cakes. We could easily have spent a couple of hours here recharging our batteries after some of the more frantic sightseeing and shopping we tried to fit into our limited time in Sydney.

Symbolisms in Chinese Landscape and Architecture. A tranquil yet compact garden in the hustle and bustle of Sydney. The Chinese Garden is well located with close proximity to Chinatown. Well designed with characteristics and symbolism of Chinese landscape and architecture.

A piece of paradise in the bustling city. Tucked in the South East corner of Darling Harbour, The Chinese Garden is a peaceful, serene hideaway. If you want somewhere quiet to contemplate your visit to Sydney, this is the place to go.

Stunning Peaceful Place. So glad we included this visit in our short stay, the staff were friendly and oh what a delightful peaceful place with beautiful shrubs and trees, an abundance of birdlife and Coy Carp in the streams it is and a photographer's paradise, we even managed to get a photo of what looked like a dragon Lizard that lived in the water.

Absolutely perfect!!!!. What a haven to find in the busy and commercial Darling Harbour area. Entrance fee was really cheap for Sydney (about $15 for a family of four from memory). The gardens are surprisingly bigger than you first think when you go in. Brilliant waterfalls and water features. Great spot for a light meal or relaxing morning or afternoon tea next to the large water feature.

Amazing hidden surprise!. This site wasn't among the top spots listed in the tour guides - in fact, we stumbled upon it late in our searches for sightseeing hopefuls. However, as it turned out, it was just a block or two from our hotel, and we made it a must-see based on a few photos we found. Well worth visiting, even if it was drizzling rain while we were there - beautiful gardens, unusual rock formations, wonderful environment. Unbelievable that such a beautiful, peaceful garden is right in the center of the city!

A Calmness in the heart of the city. I always come here, it is the calmness in the heart of the ciry it cost to get in isn't much, they have a little shop inside where you can dress up as a princess, queen, prince or king and walk around the gardens and take your own photos.The gardens are exquisite, a Chinese tea house, and you can also feed the carp (fish) at special feeding times. A great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Great for solo, family, and couples.

Tranquility in the heart of a city. Such a relaxing and tranquil attraction, just near Darling Harbour, well worth a fairly inexpensive entrance fee to spend some time wandering through the lovely gardens and enjoying the serenity. Wonderful way to spend some time.

an enjoyable outing. Was there a while ago. Love the atmosphere and enjoyed our outings there in Deember 2014. We took our relatives who was visiting Sydney there. We had a nice time taking photos and enjoyed cups of tea there.

Thoroughly recommend.. We were transported to China whilst in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Easily reached from Darling Harbour or Chinatown by foot. So very beautiful. And so glad we took time out to visit. Very reasonable entry cost.
peaceful gardens. spent around 40 minutes going through the gardens very well laid out can also have refreshments there,i enjoyed it,i think it was 6 dollars which isn't much,

Nice and quiet garden. I don't normally like gardens but this garden really amazed me. It costs $6 to enter but it is worth it. It is really beautiful and the garden looks amazing. There are places to sit where you can rest and admire the garden. I recommend this garden to anyone.

serenity in the heart of hustle & bustle. What a stunningly beautiful & peaceful find in the heart of Sydney. It was so unexpected and calming after a big morning!!!! Everyone, please give yourselves a few hours break from the hustle & bustle of the city & visit this gem!!
What price Friendship ?. It was very disappointing to find a small charge for this garden. A donation system would be more appropriate.

nice place. We had a nice relaxing meal at the restaurant.. The gardens are so well maintained. Beautiful place to relax. Then we went for a drive to see the prison camp remains... would of been nice to have had the time to walk there
Nice quiet spot to rest.. A really beautiful place amongst the hustle and bustle of Darling Harbor. Very much worth the $6 entry. A nice place to just relax for a while.

Quiet escape. When we were there, it felt like we weren't in the middle of Sydney city any more! We saw that you can actually dress up in Chinese outfits if you're into that kind of thing, and there were plenty of Koi fish swimming around in the lakes.
Nothing special to mention. it is located near to the market. Need to pay to get in. Out of all the free attraction not worth going.

The Secret Hidden Gem of Sydeny. Stunningly beautiful gardens right in the heart of the city. You would never know it was there but it's a wonderful haven of tranquility in a busy metropolis. Massive goldfish, gorgeous buildings and garden layout. I brought work colleagues here for a hen afternoon tea; the bride to be was astounded and none of the other girls, all resident Sydneysiders for sometime, had never been before. Teahouse is great and the beautiful jade wedding carriage is an amazing work of art. Would be a perfect event space.
Lovely quiet resting spot. The garden is truly lovely, even on a wet day that I had. Recommend that you do take the guided tour just to get more history and detail of the plantings.
Was OK. Nice garden. Kids had fun finding the animals hidden in the gardens. Doesn't really take long to walk around. You can also dress up in Chinese clothes if you like.
Quiet Haven. Small enclosed Chinese themed garden on the edge of Cockle bay. A tranquil haven from the bustle of the tourist trail around the bay.
Calm little garden. Beautiful but quite small. Please, please bring insect repellent if you are going to be there for a while...

must see this peaceful garden. love the history and reason for the chinese garden being built.there is so much to see and if you do not follow the map then you will miss out on a lot of things -which i did the first time. i just love the sereness of the garden.i have been to the garden about three times or more and every time i see something different.took loss of pictures.

a unique walled 'oasis' in the centre of the city. Recommend a visit to this unique Chinese themed garden in the centre of the city. Peacefull with abundant bird life and fish throughout the waterways. Waterfalls, chinese artifacts and the wall enclosing the entire environment make the gardens a special place to visit.

Beautiful and Relaxing. Wonderful, beautiful. Take the time to enjoy the serenity of this beautiful garden. The walkways are wonderfully situated to allow you to feel the garden is much bigger than it actually is. A perfect place to relax. A calming walk with all that you expect from a Chinese garden. Can be done in 20 minutes or 2 hours.

Another world in the heart of Sydney. I was very impressed with the Chinese Garden. By joining one of the free tours I learned a lot about the history of its development and the meaning of the design and layout.Although the Garden is in not in the quietest part of Sydney I was surprised at some of the wildlife which live there, including birds turtles and lizards. The garden is designed so that winding paths constantly guide you to new features through a landscape of flowers, shrubs, lakes, waterfalls and stone.It really added to the atmosphere by seeing people walk through the Garden dressed in traditional ornate costumes from the on-site hire shop.At the end of my visit I combined Chinese and Australian culture by having Jasmin tea and scones with jam and cream in the tea house.
Simpily Beautiful. Loved the Chinese Gardens! So beautiful and relaxing. If you looking for something relaxing and cheap I would recommend going for a walk through the Chinese Gardens.

Highlight. This was one of the highlights of my trip. It so peaceful was tranquil and for photographer it's a gold mine! Another plus side was that it was cheap to enter $6 and they had interesting options for Chinese tea etc which was awesome.
expensive yet boring. it is boring, nothing interesting about it, the guide is very lethargic, the so-called activity for kids is poorly designed.

Serene. A beautiful Chinese garden, the only thing is from the top you look out to the garden and all around are high rises of the city. Great activities for kids to find the signs of the Chinese year like the dog, horse etc around the garden. Although in the middle of the city it was very peaceful
Disappointed. Spoilt by all the renovations going on at Darling Harbour Unfortunately all this area is virtually spoilt by the rebuilding
Parafise. Nothing like a calming and relaxing space right in the middle of a bustling city. Any time of year the gardens are perfect. Take some time out and enjoy a pot of tea in the gardens.
Tranquility. A rare gem in the middle of the city - you can almost forget that you are in a big city, It is peaceful here.
something different. A little bit of tranquility in a very busy area.A must see when travelling in Sydney.Very calming & the children love it

A nice getaway from city bustle. The Chinese garden (between the city and adjacent to Darling Harbor is a nice refuge from the city bustle, and for a small fee, you can spend an hour or two here looking at some attractive gardens and finding a bit out about Chinese culture in Sydney. You can even dress up if you want to, or just laugh at the people who did. They do feel a bit surrounded by the city buildings which are tending to encroach.

Tranquil escape. This is a little oasis off the entertainment quarter. It would be easy to miss. They do food which is fine enough - a little expensive for what it is. it's to be here for the atmosphere - great during the day if you want to escape...

Just a garden. Had a walk around the garden with the family and it was really about 15 minutes worth of interest for us. Its a lovely garden and setting but would not hold a young persons interest to long.

Beautiful despite being winter and a cloudy day. Delightful area to stroll and enjoy the architecture of the gardens as well as the plants and flowers. The stark winter bare branches against a grey Sydney sky was a different perspective. Keen to return in spring when I think it will be even more delightful. We found the staff at the entrance to be so helpful and friendly.We decided to have the scones and tea, would not elect to do this again. The scones were reheated in the microwave and the cream was a pressure spray pack variety. Not pram friendly in parts and there is the option for a free guided tour if you time your visit well.
RELAX - because you can. This was an amazing yet tranquil place.Rest your head. Catch your breathe. Enjoy the majesty of nature

a must visit. it is so beautiful! Of course Sydney has one of the most vibrant Chinese cultures in the World, and the friendship gardens is a beautiful place to eat. It is really an Oasis in the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Located just off wattle bay near darling harbour it is close to everything

bring your walking shoes. A lovely tranquil place in Sydney. Affordable prices, we got a family pass for $15.Beautiful gardens with peaceful spots for reflection.There are some very uneven rocky steps so bring suitable footwear.
Too expensive. Disppointing that it costs $13 to enter. Not worth the cost. Walk Darling harbour or enjoy a meal in Chinatown

Peaceful place in Darling Harbour. Beautiful garden, we spent a few hours there, had a few bites and tea by the lake. So peaceful, a quiet getaway from the city. The entry fee is small, worth the visit. We took over a 100 pictures, just so beautiful.

A peaceful place go in and feel the spirit. In middle of the hectic CBD, just on Darling Harbour is this wonderful little space .. take a visit and feel the peace inside, by all those building works around for the new Darling Harbour.

peace at last.. it was so peaceful just sitting and letting the world go bye.We are going back to visit the gardens again The busy traffic outside the Chinese Garden of friendship you just did not hear it. Just walk round and take in how peaceful it is.take lots of photographs .

Wait until the building site next door has been completed. So disappointed rather a long walk from the ferry and for somewhere that is meant to have tranquility due to the huge building project going on next to it you feel as if you are sitting in the middle of it and the noise from there awful

Well worth a visit. The gardens are in Darling Harbor and are well worth a visit.. There is a small entrance fee. The gardens are beautiful and easy to walk around. They are accessible for people in wheelchairs.
Relaxing short stop. Very picturesque Chinese Garden-great photo spot! Spent about and hour and half leisurly strolling the garden.
Inner city peace. Lovely peaceful place to have a walk or small break in a busy city. Something serene about watching the Koi swim around while listening to the bamboo rustle in the wind.
Tranquility. A welcome break from the hustle and bustle of a busy city. Quiet and serene, it allows you to gather your thoughts and assess your amidst greenery and temple surroundings.
Excellent Garden with stunning views. Great place for nice photography.. Excellent Garden with stunning views. We could click few amazing shots in this garden especially with the chinese costumes.
Dreamland from far away.. Very nice. One forgets one is in the middle of Sidney. While you are there, go also to the aquarium.
Break whilst exploring the city. Well worth a visit , a great way of the busy surrounding area. Delightful gardens and a very nice place to have a coffee whilst exploring the city

Zen in the heart of the CBD. This is a truly peaceful place to stop and relax, right in the heart of the city. The waterfalls drown out the traffic noise. There is a little cafe that sells sandwiches and tea - its not too expensive. If you'd like a bit of fun, there is a dress-up area where you can put on traditional Chinese attire and take some fun photos.
Restful Relaxing Garden. Nice Chinese garden between Chinatown and Darling Harbour. A place to relax and rest. Must pay for entrance.

My 10 year old enjoyed the "treasure hunt".. Beautiful gardens and a pleasant place to wander with my 85 year old mum who can't walk far. She couldn't make it up to the top bit, but the cafe was in a beautiful position to enjoy the gardens and pond. Unfortunately there is a lot of construction work going on in the background which spoilt some of the views.

beautiful gardens. We arrived here around 8 am on a chilly , windy , winter morning. The gardens are very beautiful and the plants are exotic. The sounds of small water channels all around the park are very enterprising. The walkways are well maintained and teh exhibits are fabulous.

Chinese garden inside Sydney. one of the places inside the Darling Harbour to visit if you want a taste of the orient. It's a Chinese setting in Sydney, recommended where to have a peaceful rest. try the costumes too.
Most beautiful Chinese garden. This is the most beautiful Chinese garden I have visited It is conveniently located between China town and Darling harbour.

Chinese garden of Friendship Sydney. This is a must see spot in Sydney. It's an oasis in the Darling Harbour and does have an entry fee. You can get tantalising glimpse on the outer, but it's worth the fee and the wander. The gardens are serene and you can feel the heart and love that when into the planning of this.

A delight. I really enjoy visiting gardens and this one was a delight. It is very small, so you can spend time sitting and taking in the many plants and features. There is a place you can dress up and have a photo taken, but it was too hot to put on any extra clothes! There are lizards and fish and other live things to enjoy. We stopped in the cafe on our way out and enjoyed looking out on the fish ponds. I liked being out of the sidewalks and streets for a while.
Lovely gardens.. I don't know much about Chinese gardens and didn't expect to see this in the heart of Sydney but it is beautiful.

Asain Cultural diplay and performance in the chinese Garden !. The Chinese garden of friendship is situated in the Darling Harbour . Very Close to China Town . We have held a lot of functions there for Chinese New Year Festival , and also many other Asian events through the year . Visitors can visit there through morning to afternoon . You only pay few dollars for the admission . And you can enjoy tea or coffee there . some times they have varies culture show for performance .
Well Worth A Look Around. Chinese Gardens is very nice, peaceful and pretty. Certainly worth visiting for a day out and highly recommended.
Beautiful. A lovely few hours spent in this little piece of China in Sydney. We took our own lunch in and ate at one of the many tables scattered around this peaceful garden

Immerse yourself. Very peaceful and tranquil, a perfect setting for serenity if you're looking for quiet.
Friends got married here too, was beautiful.

Very pretty and pleasant. This is a Chinese garden that you can walk around for a small entry fee. Just a stone's throw from Darling Harbour. The garden is very pretty and pleasant, with Chinese pagoda doorways, trees and plants from the far East and even some birds. Quite a nice thing to do if you are in Darling Harbour.

Stunning . A beautiful and inexpensive place to visit.
Very interactive for young kids.
Staff are lovely!
As it is only short walk from Darling Harbour, this attraction should not be missed.

Peaceful oasis in the middle of Sydney. What a beautiful gem in the middle of the city - it is very serene and takes you away to a different world. Don't forget to stop off at the café - they have a great selection of teas!
Beautiful Chinese Garden. Beautiful Chinese Garden close to Darling Harbour, Paddy's Market etc. Don't forget your camera. Well worth a visit when you are in the area.

Oasis. Step from the hustle and bustle of Sydney into peace, tranquility and an oasis of beautiful gardens and structures. At one point you are right next to a busy road reminding you that this special place is in a city. It wasn't busy when I went, I would think if you went when it was very busy it would not be such a special experience. Choose your time and enjoy, it is well worth a visit.

Nothing special. In a city full of extraordinary free views and attractions the small fee charged for this garden was not worth it. The best thing about it was the sound of man made waterfalls partly masking nearby jackhammers in Darling Harbour.
An amazing find. Set within the hustle and bustle of a big city we came across an oasis of tranquility. A nice way to spend a couple of hours relaxing, go early to avoid the crowds.
Pleasant when not inundated with crowds. Going earlier to this area is recommended. It becomes really busy, noisy and cancels the effects of supposed peace and harmony!

You actually forget where you are!. Beautiful Chinese garden in the middle of Sydney, close to Darling Harbord. While you walk around you forget that you are in the middle of a city!!! 14$ the entrance I think. Also, at the end of your tour, take a break with a cup of chinese tea on the chinese coffee shop on the Inside.

Exquisite. A beautiful tranquil oasis in the heart of Sydney. The free tour was entertaining & informative with details on the buildings, wax rocks (!) & rocks with fossils, the plants & symbolism everywhere. Wonderful vistas from every angle - a photographers' dream! My visit was in Winter so can't wait to visit again in the other seasons.

Beautiful Scenery . This was one of the sites I wanted to visit whilst I was in Sydney and I'm glad I got to go as it was breathtaking scenery even in the winter time. It did feel as though I had wandered into Ancient China with the way it had been setup. It was so quiet and you can only hear the waterfall and the birds around you. There is a dressing up service that allows adults and children to dressed up in ancient Chinese clothes and have pictures taken but it wasn't open when I visited.The location was very convenient as it only a 10 minute walk from breakfree on George and various other hotels around the area. The admission is 6 dollars which was well worth it and I there were some Chinese sweets in the tearoom that is located near the entrance which were very nice.I would recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney for the first time as it was a lovely way to end the trip on.
Stunning.. Such a gorgeous garden! well worth visiting. Loved every minute of exploring these gardens. A very relaxing, peaceful place.

Most of can be seen for free!. It's at Darling Harbour and it costs AU$6 to enter, though much of it can be seen without going in. Inside, there are photo opportunities with pagodas and exotic plants. It's a cheap must visit place you can link with harbourside lunch at Darling.

It's ok but not that great. It has enterance fee..which not that expensive..but the garden it's self..not that special for me..it's has good .landscape ..but it's a bit boring for me..I think royal botanic garden was much worth it..or if you want to travel out west..there are free chinese garden visit in Blacktown area.

Very pretty & worth a visit . A beautiful place to take some time out. $6 entry fee ($3 for concessions) is well worth it for the peace and beauty of the gardens. Smaller than I expected, but lovely nonetheless. Lots of good photo opportunities, and a great way to kill time in between activities. Worth a visit if you can.

Dissapointed: we thought it was open (for free). We wanted to see this but had to turn back because we could not pay the entrance fee. Lovely entrance how ever and looks nice from what we could see from the outside. will be back next time with money in our pockets to see the inside.
A place to unwind and to forget you are in Sydney.. Tranquil hidden treasure. Walk ways are pleasant and inspiring and so peaceful to walk amongst the gardens. Worth a visit.

Peaceful. I loved finding somewhere quiet in the madness of Sydney. A beautiful spot to wander and just relax. There is also a lovely spot to enjoy morning or afternoon tea. I couldn't think of anywhere thats better value @ $6 per adult. Relax and breathe

China in Sydney. the garden itself is beautiful, well kept and with a refreshing ambience on a hot summer in Sydney. There's an area where you can rent Chinese costume. The staff there will assist you in wearing it and will even do your hair and accentuate it with beads and flowers. There's also a cafe inside which serves desserts and a variety of drinks. This place is a must visit when visiting Darling Harbour!

6$ but quiet and peaceful . There is a reason why they want 6$ for entrance, you are on your own and most of the tourists avoid going in and have a look because of the entrance fee. It stays quiet and peaceful. Close to darling harbour, free bus 555 and Chinatown.
Very nice!. It's a nice area to visit, and very pretty in Sydney. There are other gardens and parks in Sydney such as the Botanical Gardens and Hyde Park, as well, but this is certainly very nice.

A must visit place when you are in Sydney. I always visit the Chinese Gardens when in Sydney, it is a little piece of quiet paradise in the busy city. The carp have grown hugely since I was there last time. We enjoyed the lunch which had plenty of food in it including dessert. This is a lovely place if you want to slow down the pace of your holiday a bit. There are lovely girls wandering the gardens in traditional costume and you can get dressed up too and have your photo taken. This is a short walk from Darling Harbour and Paddy's markets and the theatre district.

Little oasis of tranquility in the bustling city of Sydney. Beautifully detailed grounds. I love to spend some time there to stroll through, and sit in various places to view the different sceneries. Well worth the modest entrance fee.

Gorgeous piece of paradise right in the city. The Chinese Gardens have always been a piece of paradise right in the heart of Sydney and a must visit when you're in town. The gardens are absolutely gorgeous as is the cafe inside where you can sit and relax over a cup of tea, take in the beautiful surrounds and pretend that you're in a forest far away... bliss!
Chinese garden experience at heart of Sydney. Nice experience of typical Chinese garden near city centre. Well maintained and with lovely sceneries for photography. Well worth the price of entry.
A peaceful spot in the city. We walked in on our way to Darling harbour. It is a lovely garden, a peaceful spot in the middle of a busy city. Absolutely worth a visit.

One of my favourite tranquil places in Sydney. Well worth it to get away from the hustle and bustle of Chinatown. Really peaceful and well-maintained. Beautiful plants and water features. Lovely wildlife and good photo-taking opportunities. Pack a picnic and sit in the sun!

One of my favorite place on Earth. This place is undesirable. Very tranquil water garden in the heart of the city. It so strange but amazing to find such piece near a booming city. Please I beg of you, go here if you can. You will not regret it
Beautiful place. Very tranquil water garden in the heart of the city.Should you need a time out from a busy tourist schedule go there.
Great place to unwind. Being in the bustle of Darling Harbour it is nice to spend time in the Gardens to just relax, recharge and unwind, and enjoy the beauty and serenity of this wonderful place.

Peace For A Moment. The walled garden is quiet. Some tourists felt it was OK for their kids to run around shouting, fighting and torturing the ducks with stones. That's part of being at a tourist attraction. I have stopped here several times in good and bad weather and found it revitalizing. The garden has no staff. Beware of the occasional druggie or flasher. Otherwise a pleasure to stop and reflect.
Can give it a miss. Go only if you have spare time to spare. It is just a small garden which Chinese decor.Entrance fees $6 per pax.
Beautiful but a bit pricey.. We thought the gardens were lovely but not very large and quite expensive. Sydney Botanic Gardens are quite extensive, lots to see and are free.

A peaceful place to take a break. A peaceful place to take a break with a beautiful view. Waterfall, flowers, ducks, birds. Have a hot tea traditional Chinese tea at the garden, delight yourself with the Chinese sweets available to acompain the tea. Don't forget to see the fish feeding at morning.
Wonderful. You must visit this wonderful garden - it is in Cockle Bay and easily accessed - it is behind the max theatre and on the city side.
Love this place. Go visit this as it is very serene and beautiful once you are inside. Beautiful gardens and you can also have a light meal or morning/afternoon tea as well.

great time out. we just happened to see this as we walked past and went ....what the hell....walked in and was just floored, we walked around a giant pond and saw all the hidden corners and wonderfull little alleys full of planted gardens and designed scuptulres....it made for a wonderfull time out from the busy inner city harbour

Nice place to spend 1 hr or so. We decided to visit this place because it was featured in one of the old Hi-5 shows and my daughter was big fan then. I was a student in Sydney some 20 years back and never step into this icon hence we decided to kill our curiosity and walk in. A nice garden and we took a few photos.
Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful and surprisingly peaceful. Perfect getaway in a busy city. Great for a stroll and/or quiet reflection. Love all the fish and ducks. A must do when in Sydney.

Weekend getaway. You are in the middle of the city and then you step into Paradise. There was waterfalls a tea room where I had a refreshing cup of tea and scone listening to the water tumbling over the rocks. There was Carp that glistened in sun as they swam around the lake that were a foot long. It was so serene and peaceful and then around the corner within the gardensI came across Chinese costumes where a man dressed me up and took photos all for just a small donation. Alas my silly SD card has become faulty so I must return to this place and do it all again. A must see if you need a break from reality. It cost $6
What a gem in the middle of a busy city.. This beautifully set out theme garden is a must if you want a relaxing visit in a busy harbour area.

Tranquility Personified!. Do yourself a favor and take 2 hours out of your day to spend aimlessly strolling in the divine tranquility and peaceful environment of the Chinese Garden of Friendship. Beautifully appointed, manicured, embellished and detailed. You have to see this heavenly oasis embedded in the heart of the throbbing activity of Darling Harbour to believe it! What a contrast but to spend the time in the Garden is soulfully healthy and gratifying. You will feel better in mind, health and body for the experience. Make sure you fit it in to our Sydney itinerary.

Beautiful, peaceful and wow.. those fish!. What a lovely garden. Tranquility in amongst a busy city. A great place to retreat to after walking around exploring all day. Doesnt have a grass patch as such so you can't really lounge like we would have liked as exhausted travellers, but beautiful and worth the visit. They also have Chinese costumes for hire to wear and take photos with in the gardens and the costumes looked very impressive, not expensive either at $10pp (I think). Worth a visit!

Beautiful scenery.. The garden is beautiful, except way too touristy. I love walking around looking at all the beautiful scenery with my friends. If you like nice photos you could also hire ancient Chinese costume for photos. Or relax with a cup of tea in the cafe.
Peace.. Went just over 18 months ago. A peaceful garden to sit and contemplate life. Could have spent all day here..Hard to believe it is in a bustling city.
chinese gardens. a magical place, very beautiful being able to dress in chinese costumes to walk around truly amazing

A Tranquil Escape in the heart of the city. We had been in the city for the day and on our way our of Darling Harbour saw the gardens and decided we'd go and have a look around. We were so pleased that we did. The setting is glorious with beautiful gardens, water features and places to just sit and reflect. There is a cafe but we didn't go in however it did look like you could continue to enjoy the views whilst enjoying a cuppa. Whilst it did't affect us we did comment that it was a shame the gardens didn't appear to be very user friendly for wheelchair users or those less steady on their feet. For everyone else, we would highly recommend
Quiet and serene. Amazingly peaceful place in the middle of a bustling city. Beautiful and serene. Well worth the time to visit.
Breathtaking. Was simply stunning! The gardens were beautiful and the lady that gave the talk was very informative.

A Place to Refresh. A dream to visit and beautifully landscaped. In the heart of the city and a nice way to take a break from an extraordinary city filled with hustle and bustle. We visit it every time we are in Sydney. Don't miss it when your there.

Beautiful escape in the middle of the city . Gardens are beautiful, well maintained and relaxing. Tours are interesting. Great value with low priced entry.
Didn't get to try it, but the high tea was well priced and looked lovely, especially as you're seated in the gardens.

Nice surprise. 5 minutes form our hotel we found this little gem, its worth having a look, the place seemed well looked after & so photogenic, even though it was raining it was lovely to walk through the gardens
Haven of peace in the middle of the city. The peace, the beauty, the harmony and the joy you feel here, come and see for yourself, you will not regret it.

Peaceful and beautiful. For a small fee you can access this really tranquil space in the middle of a busy city. There are signs around the garden explaining why different parts have been laid out how they have. It was a very pleasant experience and there is a wide range of teas available in the cafe.

Beautiful spot in the middle of the city. Although the weather was bad on the day, the Chinese Garden of Friendship was a stunning spot away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I got a bit of a kick recognising bits from the second Wolverine movie.

peaceful place. these gardens are sooo beautiful, especially in their location right next to china town and paddy,s markets. very peaceful and relaxing. definitely worth the six dollar per person entry fee. worth a visit.

Chinese garden. Very beautiful vey nicely maintained near darling harbor there is a ticket for entry those who have visited China it is a miniature form of there garden style
Good for photographers Chinese dresses also available

BEAUTIFUL AND SO VERY WORTH THE VISIT!! :). We were in Sydney on holiday - we had seen the gardens from our hotel window and it looked worth a visit. We strolled down and paid entry - we made the decision to do tour guide walk through with one of the park officers there. The gardens were stunning and the amount of information we got from walking around with a guide was amazing, I would highly recommend this as you learn so much about Chinese culture and the amount of attention to detail that went into create the garden. Very much worth a visit!!!
tranquil. the chinese gardens are just so relaxing and gives you a calming affect it is just in the middle of sydney but you feel like you are in another country

Very Tranquil. We love this place - literally an oasis in the middle of bustling Sydney - very cool on a warm/hot day. Nice to just to take your time to wander around. And the scones and jasmine tea is the best! Go here every time we visit Sydney.
Beautiful. In the heart of Darling Harbour, it's a nice break from the rushing & congestion. Very nice place to relax!

Chinese Garden of Friendship. This is a beautiful oasis of tranquility in the Darling Harbour area. It is well worth a visit. Everyone is given a brochure with a good map that enables visitors to self-guide themselves throughout the gardens.

A lovely surprise. Beautiful gardens and water features and buildings. Enjoyed looking for our Chinese horoscope animals. Children dressed up as a warrior and a princess and walked the gardens in the outfits which they loved and have some great photo's. Nice food. Forgot we were in a city!

This is a hidden Gem!. From outside the gardens, you only get a small impression of what lies within. These gardens are magnificent! beautifully laid out with hidden corners and treasures. The abundance of birds in so many of the trees make you feel that you are so far out of the city. I would highly recommend a wander round the garden!

Lovely break from city hustle and bustle!. Lovely garden oasis in the centre of a big busy city. Shame about the surrounding building going on at the moment but some beautiful tranquility none the less. Bargain entry and lovely to walk through.

Peace and Tranquility. What a perfect gem to find in the midst of a burgeoning metropolis! Pass through the traditional red gates, and you are 'transported' to Sydney's sister city in China. The gardens, the plants, the sculptures, the buildings, and the water features, all combine to lift the stresses of our modern day lives from our shoulders, giving us feeling of well-being, and calmness. A half hour here pleasantly turned into three hours, such was the calming influence this 'Oasis of Serenity', had upon us. Don't miss it, and be prepared to 'lose' more time than you originally planned to on your visit -- -- you won't regret it !!!john and Elaine Kruger, Melbourne.
Average. Nice to wander through if you're also visiting the Chinatown area and the water park and restaurant area nearby.

Very pretty garden, great kids activity!. Took the family here as part of a day out in the city. The staff were great with the kids, and offered them a fun activity to do while walking around the gardens. They had to find each one of the Chinese Zodiac animals in different parts of the garden. The kids thought it was fantastic and we got some lovely photos!

Interesting gardens - worth the visit.. We stopped in at the gardens and were lucky enough to have timed it right for the free guided tour. This made the experience so much better as the guide knew her material well and had a great sense of humour and friendliness about her. We found the walk and visit interesting and learned a few things about Chinese culture that we had not previously known. We thought it was great value (we paid seniors price but even at full price it is good value). It is certainly a better option than the tourist attractions costing $40 per head.

City Oasis. The gardens are fantastic...it is so peaceful. We sat at the many vantage points around the garden, taking our time, as there is something different in every area of the garden to admire and soak up. It is not a place to hurry through. A traditional costume can be hired for photos...or for fun. The people in costumes made the garden look even better. It is $6 to enter.....which is an absolute bargain. You can have a coffee and a snack before taking a deep breath and getting ready to face the very busy city outside the walls.
Pretty Place. A nice walk around to enjoy the gardens and ponds, along with a nice coffee shop to sit and relax in the peaceful surroundings.
wOw. Please include this as part of your Sydney Harbor vist. The gardens are breathtaking. The cost is minimal and for a little extra admission fare you can enjoy a tea luncheon!

Peaceful place in a busy city. What a hidden gem in the city. It was great to spend some down time wandering around the garden and have a quick snack in the tea house. Staff were pleasant and willing to highlight the features of the garden. Cost was reasonable.

My favourite thing in Sydney. I absolutely love the Chinese Garden. It is an extraordinarily beautiful oasis in the city. Every section of the garden is so exquisitely designed. The Gardens are also such a relaxed place to visit. The tearooms sell healthy and inexpensive food. The staff are lovely and the whole place is unhurried.

Beautiful place even when its raining!. my daughter and i visited the gardens on a cold, sprinkling with rain kind of day as it was the only time we could go, and it was still so lovely! so many beautiful photo opportunities, just lovely. I highly recommend it!

Absolutely beautiful gardens, a must see.. Family enjoyed a lovely relaxing morning in the gardens, wandering around. The kids enjoyed feeding the koi at feeding time and had a yummy morning tea, scones and pork buns.

beautiful garden in the heart of the city. For over an hour my wife and I enjoyed the Friendship Garden.To be able to view the city skyline while looking through historical garden views was a real joy. the walk was easy with a beautiful outlook.The highlight was the waterfall from every angle.

Oasis of Calm in the City!. What a delight to find these lovely picturesque gardens in the middle of the city.Beautiful scenes every few paces. We were lucky enough to join the walking tour of the gardens which is very informative and light hearted.Scones with jam and cream tea was very tasty!This is one place well worth a visit in Sydney

Pleasure . What a wonderful way to spend two hours in the heart of Sydney! Such a tranquil spot, even with all the construction going on in Darling Harbour. Grab some lunch at the Hay Market in Chinatown and bring it to these gardens to eat and take in the scenery.

Very pretty oasis in the middle of Sydney. This is beautifully laid out authentic Chinese garden. Interesting to me being of Chinese decent. Went there first about 6 years ago, much better now, with mature plantings. Tea house very cute.
Spectacular. These gardens were so much more than i was expecting, very well taken care of. They are nice and peaceful and really pretty. Great spot to sit and read a book.

Stunning garden with excellent guided tour. We went over to the Imax in Darling Harbour to watch the new Avengers film and, having arrived early, thought we'd pop to the Chinese garden as well.We weren't expecting an entrance fee ($6 each) but, after walking through the garden for a good hour, we could see where the money was spent and agreed that it was worth it. We were also very lucky in that we managed to arrive just as the free tour was starting (12pm and 2pm every day) so we got a detailed history of the origins and design of this unique space as well.Ming was a wonderful guide; you could tell she knew the garden like the back of her hand but that she was also genuinely passionate about it. She told us about each different element including the Chinese traditions and myths as well as the botanical aspects. The tour was fascinating and I would highly recommend going when that's on if you can.

Pleasant oasis. Stopped in here for about 45 minutes. The walled gardens and pools are lovely - just a shame that they are surrounded by high rise office blocks now. Our visit was somewhat marred by some badly behaved, badly parented children who thought it good idea to throw stones at the ducks. Might be a good idea if they had some staff in the gardens to monitor visitors but perhaps they usually do but just not when we visited.
Well worth a stroll. Very peaceful and calming. We spent over an hour walking around on our last day in Sydney. An amazing tranquil place in amongst the sky scrapers.

So peaceful. Completely removed from the busy city streets outside. I've been to Sydney many times and on a recent trip looked for things that I had not done before. The Chinese Gardens was the perfect escape from the busy streets full of people, cars and buses. I took a book with me and sat for a few hours in the peaceful surroundings, listening to the birds and waterfalls. I'll be adding it to every visit to Sydney from now on. A great location to unwind and really relax.
A quiet refuge from busy, noisy Sydney !. The gardens are quite small but not that wonderful ! If you want a quiet, very pleasant wander around these very nice gardens, then this is for you.

Chinese Garden of Friendship visit. No a must but if once has time to fill in, Chinese Garden of Friendship is not a bad place to visit. Entry price is reasonable and the set up is rather pleasant. There is a lovely cafe in the garden itself and once certainly can have tea/ coffee and relax in the garden atmosphere where the peaceful carps swim peacefully thus relaxes visitors.If you wish to go back on the time capsule (i,e. one can hire and dress up in ancient chinese costumes and amuses oneself and capture the memory on film.

Just checking out . If you love China Dynasty Ming kind of story and environment you will love the simple garden near Darling Harbour . Get to dress up like the King and Queen or princess costume . A small cafe there to relax after long day walk with cup of chinese tea sound good hey !

A tranquil place in the heart of Sydney. This garden was built in 1988 inspired by the Chinese community in Sydney, as a celebration of Australia's bi-centenary. It's a maze of paths, alcoves and steps around a central Lake of Brightness. The beautiful tress and shrubs, combined with the buildings and water features, offer a sanctuary from the busy Sydney life. Walk to the Southern end of the Darling Harbour precinct (past the iMax theatre) and you will find this large garden. It costs $6 for entry (concessions for pensioners, children and groups). I would say most of the area is accessible for less mobile or wheelchair bound people, apart from some of the steps up to the top.There are very clean toilets and a small coffee shop which also offers some traditional Chinese food (e.g. steamed pork buns, etc).
Waste of time - skip this one. Complete waste of time - thank God it was on my way to the Darling Harbour, so I didn't waste too much time

Recommended for all travellers as a must do !. One of the best Sydney attractions ! Affordable family fun for all ages be sure to dress up it is amazingly affordable to be transformed into Traditionl Chinese dress and take your camera and as many photos as you like. They do not try to sell you a tourist style image it is all very genuine and experience focused - what a joy - we took our boys twice in 4 days and selected different outfits and will be sure to return.

Little Oasis in the City. This wasn't our first visit to the Chinese Garden of Friendship. In fact, we first visited it way back when it opened quite some years ago. We have popped in to see it mature a few times since then, but not for a long time. So it was lovely to spend 30 minutes or so there again on a recent trip to Sydney. The price of entry also seems to be lower than the last time we visited, so that was a pleasant surprise.The gardens definitely have matured over the years, and for the most part they are quite beautiful, particularly around the lake. Weeping willows and strategically placed pagodas make for many ideal photo spots. With sun dappling the water through the willows, it was momentarily easy to forget you were in the city. But momentarily is the word. Tranquility in scenery is all there, but the noise of the surrounding city and nearby building works do intrude. Maybe once the Darling Harbour construction work is finished, that complete sense of calm and serenity will return, but given the garden's location, that may be a bit much to ask for.We love visiting gardens, and this really is a charming one; however, some of the garden beds could do with a little extra TLC. Overall, though, it is very well maintained.A person could spend more time visiting the Chinese garden, and perhaps take some time at the tea house, but we didn't linger. The garden is not huge, but it does cram a lot into a very small space. So you are able to see everything fairly quickly if you just want to take a quick walk through, or you can take your time and many photos.A word of caution, though. The paving throughout the garden is not even, so this would not be a great place to bring granny with her walking frame. Even the lower part of the garden, near the entrance, has the same cobbled pathway, so it could be a little risky for anyone with walking difficulties.Other than that, the Chinese Garden of Friendship really is an inexpensive and enjoyable way to spend a little time on a lovely Sydney day. If I worked in the city, I would probably pay the very low annual fee and go regularly for a peaceful lunchtime.

Suprisingly Good!. We stumbled across the Chinese Gardens on a recent trip to Sydney. We weren’t expecting much but we were very pleasantly surprised!A real tranquil, paradise amongst the buzz and rush of Sydney. It was just what we needed after a busy day exploring the city. The gardens were absolutely beautiful and very informative. It felt like we had been teleported to China!Great value and a great experience. Definitely recommend!

short visit. We just made it in time to visit gardens with a friend from Sydney who hadn't been. Gardens were beautiful but need maintenance. Café closes early so couldn't have tea. Very disappointing. Also charged full day fee when there was only an hour left when we arrived.

Chinese Garden of Friendship. Really enjoyed walking through this garden and found the atmosphere so relaxed. The stone arrangements were special and we have many photos of these for our photo albumn. The 6 dollars entrance was worth it.
Beautiful!. I love coming here! It is a gorgeous sanctuary in the middle of Sydney and offers an environment to step back into a new culture!

What a magnificent place in the heart of the city. Highly recommend a visit to the chinese gardens, entry is cheap and you just wouldn't realise that you are right next to the largest city in Australia unless you look up to see the buildings around you. It is a peaceful oasis in the heart of Sydney!

A unique place. This is a unique attraction in quite a small area in the city centre. You could very easily pass it by without noticing but that would be a real pity. It's winding pathways take you through different areas of Chinese culture. What a treat from the minute you enter to leaving. Quite an amount has been fitted into a small area. It is most peaceful and tranquil. Any visit to Sydney would not be complete without visiting this beautiful sanctuary. Entry fee is minimal and great value.

So wonderful!. I loved the Chinese Garden of Friendship! It's super cheap AND you can rent costume if you like. The tea and scones in the tea house were surprisingly delicious (I was expecting the furniture and room decor to be more traditional - but I'm in Australia not China so how much can you really ask for?) I would've loved to have been a child again, pretending to be Mulan and playing through the gardens wouldve been so fun! It's not enormous, so if you don't sit to admire the scenery for a while or go to the tea house then you won't need more than an hour there. However it was nice to step outside of the city and be somewhere else (though you can see the tall buildings towering over the walls, and when I went there was construction happening somewhere nearby and it was incredibly loud) Perhaps they could play some tranquil traditional Chinese music throughout the gardens, to help reduce the distractions from the city. Overall though I did love it there and I plan to go again when I am visited by relatives. Hopefully there won't be as many people next time. Highly recommended!

A piece of serenity in the middle of a bustling city. This is really a lovely place to visit particularly in autumn when the azaleas are out. It's not a vast garden but has enough beautiful little areas to sit and contemplate life. It's also a great place for younger kids with arches and bridges and Chinese dress ups ...at least there was when I was last there.
All good fund

A Beautiful Sanctuary, A Must See!!!!!. We loved it, so peaceful, gorgeous and tranquil. You will feel instantly transported to another dimension, as soon as you enter. Take a camera, you will need it,with so many wonderful photo opportunities! Be sure to visit the traditional tea rooms as well.

Beautiful Gardens. Well worth a visit, these gardens are beautiful. The pathways leading you to different treasures within the garden. You can even enjoy some time feeding the magnificent carp living in the garden waters. A beautiful oasis within the city to sit and relax. Very tranquil.

Worth a visit!. Great place to wander and relax! Nice gardens with explanations on what you're seeing. Very pretty spot for pictures and they even offer "dress up" in traditional Chinese attire.
Nice spot to have a cup of tea as well, they have a small cafe with treats and drinks.
Gem of a Garden. Every view in this garden is outstanding! Bring your camera and you can't help but take a great picture. Very well done and peaceful.

Peaceful garden so close to inner city. What a beautiful, tranquil garden, so close to the CBD!
Entering the garden is like stepping out of the city, it is quiet solitude. Well established plantings, beautifully incorporated with the ancient Chinese architecture, waterfalls and ponds. Be sure to take a camera.
There is even a Chinese zodiac adventure for the children (of all ages).

Great place to get away from the hussle. Great place to get away from the hussle of walking around Sydney, It's hard to believe there is such a beautiful and peaceful place in the middle of Sydney. A beautiful place to take some holiday photos.
Tranquil gardens in a busy city. Loved these beautifully laid out gardens with its running water and waterfalls and Chinese architecture. A must to visit if in Darling Harbour
relaxing wait. I was too early to meet friends for lunch. What could be a more pleasant wait than walk in the gardens? I was pleasantly surprised by the variety and design.

Lovely !. This is like an oasis in a desert. A calming tranquil place in the heart of the city. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the hours we spent here and would recommend a visit to all who happen to be in Sydney for whatever reason. A super experience.

A nice surprise. I'd say the gardens are a nice surprise to the chaotic city. The water, trees and gardens are all very nice. However I can't fully say that you feel like you are 'away' from the hustle and bustle of the city, and for that I give it 4 out of 5. Worth seeing though. Oooh - don't forget the mosquito repellent.

A place of peacefulness in the middle of the city!. It was awesome! We visited the day after the New Years Eve Firework and we were a bit tired. It was so nice and relaxing to walk around and sit down a bit. Definitely can recomment it for all travellers old and young :)

Restful gardens. The Chinese Garden of Friendship in the heart of Sydney is a stunning, peaceful, beautiful place. For only A$6 you can spend the day or come and go as you please. There are many spots to sit and relax, just listening to the waterfalls and enjoying the birds and the koi in the pools. Highly recommend a visit.

An absolute must see. What a beautiful restful place - do not miss this.I've been to a few "Chinese" gardens but this is the best ever - if you like koi try to be there when they feed them at 1130 each day.

Gorgeous!. Small, but well with the inexpensive admission price. You can tour the garden quickly, so I'd bring a book and settle in amongst the tranquility for a while. The swooping cranes and giant coy are quite beautiful as well.

An Oriental photographers paradise. This is a treasure right in the centre of Sydney, in Darling Harbour, where I couldn't stop taking pictures. Each step around the pathways offered another vista, with flowers,archways, ponds and waterfalls. Every corner offered another opportunity, with fish and wildlife, and even a couple of cheeky lizards so tame, I'm sure they were studying humans as well as vice versa. And then a small sleeping buddha-like statue close to the perimeter wall where the hustle and bustle of city traffic failed to penetrate the peace and tranquility of these beautiful Chinese Gardens.

Wow! Visual overload! Exceeded Expectations. For $6 this must be the best value in Sydney. The garden is stunning in the layout and the harmony of the elements. It is brilliantly designed - every archway, gap in the foliage, pathway corner gives onto beautifully framed views of other features of the garden. Even in April, autumn, there are colourful flowers still blooming. One could return again and again and find new symmetries and framings.The whole effect of this peaceful harmony is one of satisfaction at the wholeness of it, the way the different areas complement each other while remaining distinct. If you have seen the Chinese garden in Christchurch, albeit much newer, this one blows it out of the water!
peaceful. I cannot believe how tranquil and peaceful this garden is in the middle of the city.. i could of sat there all day only the rain came on lol.. a place to visit!
Beautiful garden and lovely cafe. The gardens are beautifully planted with different views from every point. The cafe overlooks the lake. This is an unexpected oasis in the middle of a busy city.
Chinese Garden of Friendship. Great peaceful location in the heart of the city. Surprisingly accurate detail makes this a genuine Chinese Garden.

Tranquility in the heart of Sydney. While visiting Darling Harbour, Sydney, I enjoyed stopping in at the Chinese Garden of Friendship. Offering tranquility, and an insight into oriental gardening, history and architecture, the visit was well worth it.

Chinese Garden of Friendship. A marvelous place to be in the heart of Darling Harbour. The Yin Yang comes through very strongly and the many paths take you to the most lovely settings and a quaint tea area.Water plays a major role in the setting, as do structures of Chinese design full of symbolism. A must see!

Chinese Gardens. I've been here several times, has a small Bonsai display but there is lots to admire throughout the gardens, some examples of Chinese architecture in the pavilions, if you don't look up & outside the fence you'd have no idea you're in a CBD and keep an eye out for the Water Monitors, good for photo opportunities
